dr.evomodel.arg.coalescent
Class VeryOldCoalescentLikelihood

java.lang.Object
  dr.inference.model.AbstractModel
      dr.inference.model.AbstractModelLikelihood
          dr.evomodel.arg.coalescent.VeryOldCoalescentLikelihood
All Implemented Interfaces:
Units, Loggable, Likelihood, Model, ModelListener, StatisticList, VariableListener, MPISerializable, Identifiable, java.io.Serializable
Direct Known Subclasses:
ARGCoalescentLikelihood
public class VeryOldCoalescentLikelihood
extends AbstractModelLikelihood
implements Units

A likelihood function for the coalescent. Takes a tree and a demographic model.

Parts of this class were derived from C++ code provided by Oliver Pybus.

Version:
$Id: VeryOldCoalescentLikelihood.java,v 1.43 2006/07/28 11:27:32 rambaut Exp $
Author:
Andrew Rambaut, Alexei Drummond
See Also:
Serialized Form

Constant Field Values

COALESCENT

public static final int COALESCENT
Denotes an interval after which a coalescent event is observed (i.e. the number of lineages is smaller in the next interval)

See Also:
Constant Field Values

NEW_SAMPLE

public static final int NEW_SAMPLE
Denotes an interval at the end of which a new sample addition is observed (i.e. the number of lineages is larger in the next interval).

See Also:
Constant Field Values

NOTHING

public static final int NOTHING
Denotes an interval at the end of which nothing is observed (i.e. the number of lineages is the same in the next interval).

See Also:

getExcludedMRCAs

public NodeRef[] getExcludedMRCAs(Tree tree)
Returns:
an array of noderefs that represent the MRCAs of subtrees to exclude from coalescent prior. May return null if no subtrees should be excluded.

Specified by:
handleModelChangedEvent in class AbstractModel

handleVariableChangedEvent

protected final void handleVariableChangedEvent(Variable variable,
                                                int index,
                                                Variable.ChangeType type)
Description copied from class: AbstractModel
This method is called whenever a parameter is changed.

It is strongly recommended that the model component sets a "dirty" flag and does no further calculations. Recalculation is typically done when the model component is asked for some information that requires them. This mechanism is 'lazy' so that this method can be safely called multiple times with minimal computational cost.

Specified by:
handleVariableChangedEvent in class AbstractModel

storeState

Stores the precalculated state: in this case the intervals

Restores the precalculated state: that is the intervals of the tree.

acceptState

protected final void acceptState()
Description copied from class: AbstractModel
This call specifies that the current state is accept. Most models will not need to do anything. Sub-models are handled automatically and do not need to be considered in this method.

Specified by:
acceptState in class AbstractModel

getLambda

private double getLambda()
Returns a factor lambda such that the likelihood can be expressed as 1/theta^(n-1) * exp(-lambda/theta). This allows theta to be integrated out analytically. :-)

setupIntervals

protected final void setupIntervals()
Recalculates all the intervals from the tree model.

collectAllTimes

private static void collectAllTimes(Tree tree,
                                    NodeRef node,
                                    NodeRef[] excludeBelow,
                                    java.util.ArrayList times,
                                    java.util.ArrayList<java.lang.Integer> childs)
extract coalescent times and tip information into ArrayList times from tree.

Parameters:
node - the node to start from
excludeBelow - an optional array of nodes to exclude (corresponding subtrees) from density.

get number of intervals

public final double getInterval(int i)
Gets an interval.

getLineageCount

public final int getLineageCount(int i)
Returns the number of uncoalesced lineages within this interval. Required for s-coalescents, where new lineages are added as earlier samples are come across.

getCoalescentEvents

public final int getCoalescentEvents(int i)
Returns the number coalescent events in an interval

getIntervalType

public final int getIntervalType(int i)
Returns the type of interval observed.

getTotalHeight

public final double getTotalHeight()
get the total height of the genealogy represented by these intervals.

isBinaryCoalescent

public final boolean isBinaryCoalescent()
Checks whether this set of coalescent intervals is fully resolved (i.e. whether is has exactly one coalescent event in each subsequent interval)

isCoalescentOnly

public final boolean isCoalescentOnly()
Checks whether this set of coalescent intervals coalescent only (i.e. whether is has exactly one or more coalescent event in each subsequent interval)
